column4: Hey there, I'd really appreciate a little help on a partition problem :)
what's the issue?
Got an "error 16 : inconsistent filesystem structure" with grub
And therefore can't boot anything with grub
So I booted with the live cd
And tried a e2fsck : it tells me I have a superblock problem
Then I tried a few e2fsck -b XXXXX
ah ?
But here on the live cd, I can mount all my partitions without any problem
netbfly: maybe a bad grub install? Bad MBR...
Well, I chrooted and tried a grub-install, but the problem remains
netbfly: if you can mount all partitions from the live CD and fsck runs clean on all of them from the live CD then something else is going on
With sudo grub-install /dev/hda, it does install on the MBR, right ?
nbfly: it should
nbfly: can you specify boot params with the live CD?
sure, which ones ?
nbfly: you could try to boot from the live CD setting the root to your real root partition
ah, nice idea
nbfly: root=/dev/hda<#>
I guess I can find the right option by pressing F1, F2, etc., at boot time ?
root=, ok, great, I'll try that
thanks !
nbfly: let me know if that works, I'll be on a while
thanks a lot, I'll reboot right away :)
